SoundEcology2 0.0.11

Create time series analysis and visualization for acoustic index data

Source: R/index_ts.R
index_ts.Rd

This function processes acoustic index data, summarizes it by day/week/month, and creates interactive visualizations with optional smoothing. It handles datetime parsing from filenames, data summarization at different temporal resolutions, and generates plots with range ribbons and average values.

Usage

index_ts(
  data,
  index_name = "adi",
  extra_title = "",
  start = NULL,
  end = NULL,
  span = 0.3,
  summarize_by = "day"
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing acoustic index data. Must include columns: 'index', 'file_name', and 'value_avg'.

index_name

The name of the index to analyze (default: "adi"). Used for plot labels.

extra_title

Additional text to include in the plot title (default: "").

start

Optional start date for filtering data (format: "YYYY-MM-DD").

end

Optional end date for filtering data (format: "YYYY-MM-DD").

span

Span parameter for LOESS smoothing (default: 0.3).

summarize_by

Temporal resolution for the main plot: "day", "week", or "month" (default: "day").

Value

A list containing:

  • daily_tibble: Data summarized by day

  • weekly_tibble: Data summarized by week

  • monthly_tibble: Data summarized by month

  • plot: Interactive plotly visualization of the time series

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Extracts datetime information from filenames

  2. Parses datetime using multiple possible formats

  3. Summarizes data at daily, weekly, and monthly levels

  4. Filters data based on start/end dates if provided

  5. Creates an interactive plot with range ribbons and average line

  6. Optionally adds LOESS smoothing when enough data points exist

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage
result <- index_ts(acoustic_data)

# With custom parameters
result <- index_ts(acoustic_data, 
                  index_name = "ndsi",
                  extra_title = "Forest Site A",
                  start = "2023-01-01",
                  end = "2023-06-30",
                  summarize_by = "week")
} # }
